value: Design for a Vase on an Octagonal Pedestal

label: Description
value: Sphinxes project from the oblique sides of the pedestal which shows farther up a palmette fringe. Satyr masks and a grapevine festoon decorate the concave top section of the vase.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Three large and three small shell-shaped bowls and a branch with a socket are fastened to a central post which is topped by a ring. Two boys support lower ones of the large bowls. The branch and the small bowls are outlined.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black, brown ink, brush and gray wash, graphite on cream wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: On a wooden plinth, calyxes surround the lower part of the body, a wave motif on shoulder, leaves on neck; two handles made up of griffins.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Two glass bottles with handles and chained stoppers stand in a tub-shaped stand with fluted feet. The stand is decorated with cut out lozenge ornaments. The handle of the stand in middle with an upside down triangular-shaped handle, and fluted feet. The drawing has been folded.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a panel decoration showing a ewer, for a plate in the "Recueil d' Ornements"

label: Description
value: A thyrsus is fastened to a pitcher by a festoon. The pitcher shows bacchic scenes; water pours from the dolphin forming the handle. A grape vine grows around it. Plates and fruit on the base.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, pen and ink, brush and wash

label: Provenance
value: Hippolyte Destailleur; After 1906, collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The sauceboat is made of gilded silver.  The bowl is oval shaped, decorated with a small medallion under the lip, a leaf pattern and narrower border under the rim.  The handle consists of a winged sea horse.  The support is decorated with palm leaves, and the base, which rests on lions' feet, has leaf motifs along the sides.

label: Physical description
value: Pen, washes, black ink, sepia washes

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for an Oval Gallery Tray, with Alternate Suggestions

label: Description
value: Oval gallery tray with six alternate designs for the galleries, composed of stylized plant or leaf forms.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black, brown ink, brush and gray washes on wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Shown from side. The handle formed by a winged mermaid is at right. A grapevine rinceau grows from the fishtail leg. Oblong plinth alternatively suggested with or without leaf shapes on moldings. Supported by lion feet with shells and leaf scrolls.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A palmette decoration is alternatively suggested for the outer moulding; shaped squarely.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: At top, a cup on a base terminating in lion's feet and floral medallions.  The bowl is decorated with grapevine, and encircled about the brim with a stylized leaf motif repeating in alternation.  At bottom, a shallow vessel on a stem, whose handles are composed of snakes, issuing from the acanthus leaves and loosely coiled about the stem.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Side view; boat supported by a globe and a turtle. The handle consists of two horns of a satyr mask. Spout is turned left.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Description
value: Openwork wire bread basket in center.  The basket as well as the base are octogonally shaped shaped.  The openwork handle of the basket is laid down on the left rim. Fragment of writing in red lower right.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Urn-shaped of mottled blue stone with gilt bronze mounting. About base of urn, rayed laurel leaves; at sides: two vertical volute handles with a satyr mask at the point of junction with sides; three branches emerging from top, with foliate decoration supporting each foliate candle socket. Framing ink line and stripe.

value: Graphite, pen and ink, brush and watercolor on white paper

value: Design for a saltcellar with the bowl of the vessel in the shape of a shell supported on the back of a bearded triton who swims through waves.

label: Description
value: Chimarae and a central rod at base support the shaft which is shaped as a round gaine and ends with a vase, topped by Cupid and a socket. Two branches are composed of scrolls and winged pathers. Fragment of the red numbering, bottom right, cut off.

value: A small grapevine is wound around a column upon which two sphinxes support a starred sphere. Fastened to it by spokes is a ring supporting light sockets of which seven are shown.

value: Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line

label: Description
value: A column surrounded by a grapevine stands on a high pedestal and is topped by two swans supporting a starred sphere. Fasted to it is a ring intended to carry six sockets of which four are shown. Bottom right corner: "N 55;" in reddish ink

value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Description
value: A grape vine is wound around a column upon which two swans support a starred globe. Fasted to it by spokes is a ring supporting eight sockets, or which seven are shown.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Provenance
value: Previously owned by Jean Léon Decloux, French, 1840–1929

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Fluted shaft is topped by a bowl with a flame. From fantastic heads underneath grow two branches. High pedestal shows lion heads with stripes of the hides and two crossed clubs. Feet and a plinth which is flanked by boxes.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The body is banded by an arabesque frieze with lions and a medallion portrait in the center. The handles are formed by paired snakes issuing from a bound cluster of leaves. The finial is banded by a frieze of arabesques, vases, half-fish, half-swans, and masks, and rests on animals' feet. Lower right (in red ink): "No 4 [?]" (cut off)

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Provenance
value: Previously owned by Jean Léon Decloux, French, 1840–1929

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Wall Panel with Fireplace

label: Description
value: Wall elevation featuring fireplace with overmantel and cove above, all in the Rococo style.  C- and S-curves abound on every section of the ornament.  In the center of the overmantel one finds a representation of a pastoral scene framed by feathery plant ornament with raffle leaves that curve over central field and onto the chimney panel.  Some of the plant ornament extends past the entablature and into the area of the cove.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray and light violet wash, graphite on white laid paper, ruled border in pen and black ink

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The tureen is composed of two separate design schemes: the left side includes banding of calyxes and the handle terminates in a human head helmeted with a cornucopia. The base is edged in triangular-shaped scallops. On the right the design shows a vine arabesque meander and the handle is formed by an elephant's head, trunk upraised.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, graphite on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Bowl with cover ornamented with flower and vegetal forms, with an artichoke for finial.  Handles are composed of lions' heads holding rings in mouths. Feet are animal paws issuing from large leaves.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Vessel is banded with leaf and classical arabesque motifs. The finial is in the form of a turtle. Tureen rests on three griffins on a platform.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The vessel is banded with an alternating leaf motif placed diagonally. The lid is banded with fan-shaped scallops and with the finial in the shape of a small urn. Handles composed of coiled snakes. The tureen rests on a platform with a leaf meander band.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and washes on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The vessel is banded with a grapevine meander. The finial is in the form of a crouching lion, and coiled snakes, form the handles. The base rests on paw feet and is encircled iwth a similar grapevine meander band. Lower right (in red ink): "No. 21."

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Provenance
value: Previously owned by Jean Léon Decloux, French, 1840–1929

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The vessel is banded with a grapevine meader. The finial is in the form of a crouching lion, and coiled snakes form the handles. The base rests on paw feet and is encircled with a similar grapevine meander band. Lower right (in red ink): "No. 40."

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Provenance
value: Previously owned by Jean Léon Decloux, French, 1840–1929

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The vessel is banded by an interweaving vine and ribbon meader. The finial is a spread eagle and coiled snakes form the handles. The base rests on birds' feet and is decorated with acanthus leaves and flowers.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and washes

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The vessel is banded with grapevine suspended from satyrs' heads. The finial is composed of a lion rampant supporting a blank shield and snakes form the handles. A similar banding is on the base, resting on tapering fluted feet.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and washes

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The vessel and base are banded by grapevine. A seated lion supporting a blind shield forms the finial, and the handles are in the form of arched snakes issuing from lotus buds. The base rests on paw feet.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and washes

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The vessel is banded with a vine meander, and the finial is in the form of an urn resting on acanthus leaves. The handles are composed of lions' heads with rings in their mouths. The base is banded with vine arabesques interrupted by acanthus leaves, and the feet are tapered and fluted.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and washes

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Fountain in a Park

label: Description
value: Square with trees and figures represented out of scale with the gigantic fountain. It has a hexagonal basin. The water pours from an obelisk in the center and from the jars of pairs of stream gods and goddesses who crouch upon obliquely disposed pedestal rising from a circle of boulders.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The bowl-shaped vessel is supported on high legs with repeating leaf decoration and paw feet. A band about the body of the vessel shows a mask separating alternate schemes of leaf or military attributes decorations. Helmets form handles, and the finial is in the shape of a mask and dogs' heads surmounted by stylized leaves. The top is ornamented with oak leaves.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The vessel rests on three eagles on a circular base decorated with leaves. The vessel is banded and decorated with stylized leaf forms and the handles terminate in lyres with the head of Apollo. The finial is made up of a pair of female sphinxes seated back to back.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The circular vessel is supported by two caryatides and in the center by a man shoeing a winged horse. The base rests on seated sphinxes. The vessel is banded by motifs of gryphons, and the handle is in the form of three-faced Janus with a ring through its mouth.The finial is in the form of a kneeling putto giving a swan of drink from a cup.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and washes

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The vessel rests on swans posed on columns. The handles are in the form of snakes, and the finial is composed of a recumbent lion. The base rests on cloven hoofs springing from acanthus leaves. A repeating leaf arabesque motif encircles the base.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and washes

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
